title: Brand new Pixel 4a 5G no longer starts after official updates
content:
Hello,

I received my Pixel 4a 5G today and just set it up briefly and did the system updates. And total crap: after the 3rd update (1 update to Android 11 and two security updates) the phone no longer starts. Only the Google icon is displayed. I really have never experienced anything like this before! I really did nothing but install the official updates. This can't be true!!!

I have tried everything to get it working again: Tried to fix it via Rescue Mode and Google Pixel - Update and Software Repair (https://pixelrepair.withgoogle.com/), unfortunately it always tells me that I have selected the wrong "carrier", no matter which one I select (I don't have a carrier at all, because I bought the Pixel without a contract...)...Booted into Recovery Mode and reset the Pixel via that; brings nothing...Tried to sideload OTA, but there it shows that the phone version is more recent than the OTA. Flashing is also not possible, because the bootloader is locked and I can not unlock it, because I would have to activate the option "OEM Unlock" in the developer settings, which does not work, because the phone no longer boots.

Does anyone have any other ideas? I do not want to send it back.
